step.para:
Install single-user Nix:
$ bash <(curl https://nixos.org/nix/install)
This installs Nix in /nix. The install script uses sudo, so make sure you have sufficient rights.

See what packages are currently available:
$ nix-env -qa docbook-xml-4.3 docbook-xml-4.5 firefox-33.0.2 hello-2.9 libxslt-1.1.28 ...

Install a package:
$ nix-env -i hello
(If this builds the package locally, something went wrong).

Test that the package works:
$ which hello /home/eelco/.nix-profile/bin/hello $ hello Hello, world!

Test a package without installing it:
$ nix-shell -p hello
This builds or downloads GNU Hello and its dependencies, then starts a Bash shell where the hello command is present, without changing your normal environment:
[nix-shell:~]$ hello Hello, world!
[nix-shell:~]$ exit
$ hello hello: command not found

Update your packages:
$ nix-channel --update nixpkgs $ nix-env -u '*'
nix-env -u upgrades any packages that have is a “newer” version.

If you're unhappy with the result of a nix-env action, roll it back:
$ nix-env --rollback

Uninstalling a package doesn't delete it, so you should run the garbage collector regularly to get rid of unused packages:
$ nix-collect-garbage -d
